# ğŸ† GCP vs AWS vs Azure

## ğŸ“ˆ Market Share Comparison {.center}

| Provider | Market Share | Strength |

| **AWS** ğŸŸ§ | 31-33% | ğŸ† Largest ecosystem |

## ğŸ¯ GCP Unique Selling Points

::: {.incremental}
- **âœ… Proven Scalability** - Powers Gmail & YouTube

### ğŸ” Key Insight

# ğŸ’³ GCP Free Account & Pricing

## âš ï¸ Important Limitations {.center}

::: {.incremental}
- âŒ **No monthly rollover** - Use it or lose it

# ğŸ”§ Essential Cloud Vocabulary

## ğŸ’» Virtualization Explained

::: {.r-stack}
::: {.fragment .current-visible}
### Physical Server Reality
ğŸ–¥ï¸ Physical Server (64 CPU, 512GB RAM) â†“ ğŸ‘¤ One Customer Uses Only 2 CPU, 4GB RAM â†“ ğŸ˜¢ Massive Resource Waste!

### Virtualization Solution
ğŸ–¥ï¸ Physical Server (64 CPU, 512GB RAM) â†“ âš™ï¸ Hypervisor Layer â†“ ğŸ–¥ï¸ VM1: 2CPU,4GB ğŸ–¥ï¸ VM2: 4CPU,8GB ğŸ–¥ï¸ VM3: 8CPU,16GB Customer A Customer B Customer C
:::
:::

## ğŸ”Œ Three Ways to Access Applications

::: {.columns}

### ğŸ–±ï¸ UI (User Interface)
- Web browsers
- Visual interaction
- Point & click

### âŒ¨ï¸ CLI (Command Line)

## ğŸ—ºï¸ Regions and Availability Zones

### ğŸŒ Geographic Distribution
Region: us-central1 ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ â”œâ”€â”€ Zone: us-central1-a (Data Center 1) â”œâ”€â”€ Zone: us-central1-b (Data Center 2) â””â”€â”€ Zone: us-central1-c (Data Center 3)

::: {.fragment}
### ğŸ¯ Why This Matters
- **âš¡ Low Latency** - Deploy closer to users
- **ğŸ›¡ï¸ Disaster Recovery** - Backup locations
- **ğŸ“ˆ High Availability** - 24/7 uptime

---

## ğŸ“ˆ Performance & Reliability Concepts {.smaller}

::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="50%"}
### ğŸ“Š Scalability vs Elasticity
- **Scalability**: Handle more requests
- **Elasticity**: Auto-scale up/down
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
### ğŸ›¡ï¸ Availability vs Fault Tolerance
- **High Availability**: 24/7 uptime
- **Fault Tolerance**: Works despite failures
:::
:::

::: {.fragment}
### âš–ï¸ Load Balancing
*Distributing requests across multiple application copies*

title: ğŸ“š Google Cloud Platform (GCP) - Complete Introduction
text:
â“ Basic Cloud Computing Questions

Q1: What is cloud computing and why is it important?


A: Cloud computing delivers computing services over the internet, eliminating the need for companies to maintain data centers. It reduces costs through pay-as-you-use pricing and provides scalable resources on-demand.

title: ğŸ“š Google Cloud Platform (GCP) - Complete Introduction
text:
â“ Cloud Models Comparison

Q2: What are the main differences between public, private, and hybrid cloud?


A: Public cloud is shared infrastructure by third parties (AWS, GCP), private cloud is dedicated infrastructure for one organization, and hybrid cloud combines both - using private for sensitive data and public for non-critical workloads.

title: ğŸ“š Google Cloud Platform (GCP) - Complete Introduction
text:
â“ GCP Specific Questions

Q3: Why choose GCP over AWS or Azure?


A: GCP offers proven scalability (powers Gmail/YouTube), strong AI/ML capabilities, competitive pricing, and Googleâ€™s global network. AWS has largest market share, while Azure integrates well with Microsoft ecosystems.

title: ğŸ“š Google Cloud Platform (GCP) - Complete Introduction
text:
â“ Technical Concepts

Q4: What is virtualization in cloud computing?


A: Virtualization allows multiple virtual machines to run on a single physical server using a hypervisor. It enables cloud providers to efficiently share physical resources among multiple customers while maintaining isolation.

title: ğŸ“š Google Cloud Platform (GCP) - Complete Introduction
text:
â“ Free Tier Questions

Q5: Explain GCPâ€™s free tier offerings.


A: GCP offers $300 in free credits for 90 days for new users, plus always-free products including 1 E2-micro instance, 5GB cloud storage, and limited usage of 20+ services. Charges apply only when exceeding these limits.

title: Interactive Python with JupyterLite
text:
This document demonstrates how to embed a full JupyterLite environment in your Quarto website.


The following iframe embeds a live Python REPL powered by JupyterLite:





For a complete notebook experience, you can embed the full JupyterLab interface:






REPL Mode: Use the first embed for quick Python code execution and testing
Full Lab Mode: Use the second embed for complete notebook functionality
Packages Available: Includes NumPy, Pandas, Matplotlib, Plotly, and more via Pyodide




If you want to use your own JupyterLite deployment, simply replace the src URL:

title: Interactive Python with JupyterLite
text:
This document demonstrates how to embed a full JupyterLite environment in your Quarto website.

title: Interactive Bash Terminal
text:
This page provides direct access to your WSL bash environment through a web-based terminal powered by ttyd.



 






Click inside the terminal to start typing commands
Use resize buttons above the terminal to adjust size

Right-click in terminal for copy/paste options
Press F11 in the iframe for full browser terminal mode







Warning



Troubleshooting: If the terminal doesnâ€™t respond to input: 1. MOST IMPORTANT: Ensure ttyd is running with writable mode: ttyd -W -p 7681 bash 2. Try refreshing the page 3. Click directly in the terminal area 4. Check that port 7681 is accessible
